page.title: 06TRANSPORT
page.content: Until 1966 a railway linked Much Wenlock with Wellington, Shrewsbury & Craven Arms. Many people remember going to school & shopping by train & it was used for milk churn collection. Following closure of the line under the Beeching Act buses provided links with surrounding settlements but were withdrawn after a year for alledged lack of support.Today public transport is very limited.An infrequent daily bus service goes to Bridgnorth & Shrewsbury but not Telford. On Tuesday mornings a bus comes from some villages in the West to Much Wenlock and leaves at lunchtime. A coach operator in Much Wenlock provides private hire & contracts, a regular bingo service to Shrewsbury & a holiday express service in summer. Another firm has day trips, foreign holidays & shopping in W.Midlands.
